title: MPD Corporate Policy Manual
description: Corporate-level policy manual establishing philosophy, authority, training requirements, and compliance standards for all MPD operations

1.01.title: Core Principles
1.01.content: Work undertaken on any well shall be executed such that: 1) Loss of human life and injury shall be avoided, 2) Pollution of the environment shall be avoided, 3) Loss of the rig or damage to equipment shall be avoided.

1.02.title: MPD Purpose
1.02.content: MPD enables drilling in narrow windows where conventional methods fail by maintaining constant bottomhole pressure through applied surface back pressure, compensating for ECD variations during connections and operational changes.

2.01.title: Two-Barrier Requirement
2.01.content: At least two tested and independent safety barriers shall be present at all times. PRIMARY: MPD system (hydrostatic + AFL + SBP). SECONDARY: BOP system.

2.02.title: MPD as Primary Barrier
2.02.content: The MPD system shall be considered part of the primary well barrier during drilling operations.

2.03.title: Transition Policy
2.03.content: In the event of an unplanned influx or well control incident exceeding MPD limits, the MPD system shall be isolated and the rig's well control system shall take over.

2.04.title: Deviation Requirements
2.04.content: If two barriers cannot be obtained, access to the well requires formal risk assessment and deviation permit approval on a case-by-case basis.

3.01.title: Driller Authority
3.01.content: CRITICAL: The Driller has the authority to shut in the well without recourse to any supervisor if a suspected well control event is occurring or for any other reason deemed necessary. This authority is absolute.

3.02.title: Role Definitions
3.02.content: Driller: Primary well control responsibility. MPD Supervisor: Overall MPD operation. MPD Operators: Procedure execution and BHP maintenance. Mud Loggers: Initial kick detection and recording.

4.01.title: Prerequisite
4.01.content: IWCF Level 3 or 4 well control certification required for all positions involved in MPD operations.

4.02.title: MPD Training Levels
4.02.content: Level 1: Rig/campaign induction (all personnel). Level 2: Advanced MPD training - control systems (Drillers, Toolpushers, MPD personnel). Level 3: Well-specific simulator training (key positions).

4.03.title: Competency Matrix
4.03.content: Position-specific requirements defined in training matrix. All training must be documented and verified prior to MPD operations.

5.01.title: Per-Well Drills
5.01.content: Before MPD section: RCD pressure exceeded, NRV leak, RCD leak/element change, equipment leak, BOP connector leak, choke operation, H2S procedures, MPD well control transitions.

5.02.title: Per-Crew Drills
5.02.content: Each crew: Simulated influx detection, MPD-assisted shut-in with BOP, influx re-route to MGS.

6.01.title: Required Documents
6.01.content: Level 2: Rig-Specific Equipment Manual. Level 3: Well-Specific JOM including operations matrix, PPFG, contingencies. Level 4: Quick Reference Cards for rig floor.

6.02.title: Pre-Operations
6.02.content: HAZID and HAZOP required. Pre-spud meeting covering roles, procedures, PPFG, contingencies. Daily Driller's action plan.

6.03.title: Bridging Documents
6.03.content: HSE well control bridging document required identifying which policies apply and defining roles in well control events.

7.01.title: MoC Requirement
7.01.content: Installation of MPD equipment impacts rig well control equipment and requires formal Management of Change process.

7.02.title: Deviation Process
7.02.content: Any deviation from this manual requires Deviation Permit approved by Asset Manager. All deviations shall be risk-assessed and logged.
